page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Cars are the most convenient and popular transport for business and pleasure. Buses are infrequent or inconvenient, offering no Sunday or evening services. The most popular and regular service runs to Lampeter and Carmarthen. The latter is the busier, taking people to work, shop, or catch a train. One daily bus runs to Newcastle Emlyn and another from Aberystwyth through to Carmarthen. An infrequent service links the Beeches estate with the village. Old Age Pensioners have tokens for free transport on local buses. Many teenagers have motor cycles. A "country cars" scheme enables people to pay for private cars to take them to and fro. Tradesmen use vans to transport bread, groceries, meat, and fish for sale in the area. A car is essential for convenient transport.
